title: Personal Letters of Lucretia and James Garfield (1994) (833p) [I
description:
Title: Crete and James: Personal Letters of Lucretia and James Garfield
Editor: John Shaw
Hardcover: 397 pages
Publisher: Michigan State University Press (December 1, 1994)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0870133381
ISBN-13: 978-0870133381

Description: 
Crete and James is a collection of letters exchanged by James A. Garfield and Lucretia Randolph Garfield during the mid-nineteenth century. Of the 1,200 or so letters written, the 300 included this work chronicle their courtship and marriage, and also discuss the Civil War, political affairs, and the details of daily life during the years 1853-1881. In them, we watch Crete grow from a shy girl into a self-confident woman who guides her husband in social and political matters. Through JamesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s flamboyant yet scholarly style, and LucretiaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s detailed, perceptive insights, we come to know them as though they were our close friends. Through their correspondence, the reader also meets the many people involved in their lives. Crete and James will be of great interest to those studying womenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s history
